issue.title: Remove Ubuntu PPA installation instructions
issue.body:
Since the Ubuntu PPA from mmstick is apparently not maintained anymore,
people should no longer be instructed to install the outdated version
that is available from the PPA.

The System76 PPA repository still contains an up to date version of
Alacritty, but since it also comes with several other packages we cannot
recommend users to install it outside of Pop!_OS.

Fixes #3863.

body: Sorry about that. Packages are now syncing. Sometimes I forget.

@mmstick Thanks for providing PPA for Ubuntu, and now I am relying on your PPA since the new version excludes linux binaries on the new releases. Today the version 0.5.0 has been released, btw.

@chrisduerr Why mmstick76's PPA has been removed from the documentation? This [PAA](https://launchpad.net/~mmstick76/+archive/ubuntu/alacritty) has been updated to v0.4.3 on July 16. Only missed one release that you released today.

> Why mmstick76's PPA has been removed from the documentation?

Because it missed the 0.4.2 release entirely, even after attempting direct contact (which is already something we cannot provide for every package). So until we are confident again that this package will stay up to date, we cannot recommend it to our users.
I'd just mention that all install instructions from package managers are being removed https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/4027 anyway.

> I'd just mention that all install instructions from package managers are being removed #4027 anyway.

That is true, though documenting the PPA somewhere would still be of value. Since there's not really any good way to find PPAs like this.
@chrisduerr I get dozens of emails every day from GitHub, so sometimes I have to be mentioned again, or sent an email directly.

@mmstick Thanks for providing a binary for alacritty.  
I've added your PPA. Problem is, after updating to the latest version I get inconsistent version numbers:  
```
$ alacritty --version
alacritty 0.6.0-dev

sudo apt search alacritty
Sorting... Done
Full Text Search... Done
alacritty/bionic,now 0.5.0~1596299148~18.04~ac39dfd amd64 [installed]
  GPU-accelerated terminal emulator
```
apt repos are saying 0.5 but alacritty itself is reporting 0.6.0-dev. manpages are also for 0.6.0-dev

>apt repos are saying 0.5 but alacritty itself is reporting 0.6.0-dev. manpages are also for 0.6.0-dev

@mmstick @pvonmoradi it seems like the way version was built and deployed in PPA is faulty. The way it should be done is by using the sources we provide on release page, and so the version will be actually correct. Here it seems like the version was built of source from master branch, which is not representing release in any way, since that's the only way to get `alacritty 0.6.0-dev` as version.

If you've used the sources from master, there's likely a change that they don't match the ones we have on a release page, since master is tracking the current development, and so you may miss certain fixes or include the features which shouldn't belong to 0.5.0 candidate.

If you use our sources from release page you'll see, and that's actually a 0.5.0 release.

```
~/downloads/alacritty-0.5.0  cargo run -- --version 2> /dev/null
alacritty 0.5.0

```
